author: Jeff Parsons
title: Apple TV's subscription revolution won't force you to pay for channels you don't want to watch
text:
Apple TV's subscription revolution won't force you to pay for channels you don't want to watch 23:42, 9 September 2015 Apple's rebooted set-top box has the potential to end costly TV subscription packages Share Get daily news by email Invalid e-mail Watch this video again Watch Next 
Apple has already locked down the smartphone and tablet markets - could it be about to do the same with TV? 
This evening the tech giant revealed a brand new version of its Apple TV set-top box . 
Apart from adding Siri, it also revealed a dedicated new TV app store - which any developer can build an app for. 
That would mean any TV channel could, in theory, use an app to broadcast their content through the little black box. Reuters Eddie Cue, Apple's senior vice president of Internet Software and Services, takes the stage to discuss Apple TV 
And avoid the annoyance of having to pay an expensive subscription package full of channels you never watch. 
It's a move that could have interesting consequences for TV providers that offer bloated packages. Sky Sports Would you pay for on-demand sports as an alternative to a subscription? 
Sky has already sidestepped this issue with its Now TV service - which allows you to watch TV programmes and live sport on demand without a contract. 
Imagine paying for just a Premier League app on Apple TV and never having to bother with any other sports channels. Poll loading â€¦
